characters: WHO DO YOU THINK YOU ARE
WE'VE GOT THE BIGGEST-- BALLS OF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CREDIT CARD - propped up on a register screen. The name Sandy Bigelow Patterson. The menu screen shows 1 - Mellonball, 1 - Mellonball, 1 - Mellonball, 1 - Mellonball, 1 - Mellonball The bartender enters another order onto the tab-- 1 - Mellonball --then carries a GREEN COCKTAIL over to: A WOMAN - Carefully crafted, retro style hair. Wiglike. L bright red. Long fingernails. Her outfit is coordinated, because the good people at Jac Smith coordinated it for her. Her credit card says Sandy Patterson, but we will call he DIANA. And Diana is shitfaced. She takes the drink and downs it in one long gulp. Looks the man next to her at the bar, who talks with a woman.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey chin. What's your name? THE GUY - handsome, dimpled chin, turns warily to her.

dialogues.speaker: GUY AT BAR
dialogues.text: Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Kyle, you're a cool guy, right? Let me get you a drink. On me.

dialogues.speaker: GUY AT BAR
dialogues.text: It's okay. We're actually having a private conversation. He angles his body to cut this weirdo off from them. A slight flash of rejection crosses her face. Then she se his CREDIT CARD RECEIPT on the bar. She casually takes it, like a pickpocket. Then she looks around at the rest of the people in the ba Nicer clientele. Couples, groups. Respectable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are my FRIENDS! I'm buying my friends a shot! She grabs the bottle of MIDORI from the bar. The bartende puts a hand on her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: These aren't your friends. And I think you've had enough.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (quite serious) I've had enough when the card stops working. He reluctantly lets her have the Midori. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Okay, who wants a Melon Ba--- She stumbles over the stool rungs and FALLS out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (struggles back up) I'm okay! I'm good! I gotta be honest, there's an angel looking out for me, cuz normally that's a cracked rib. Pulled a lotta g's there. Diana hears tittering. Some pretty women at a table laugh at her. Rolling their eyes. Their perfect boyfriends too. A flicker of pain crosses Diana face once more. Then she walks over to their table with an honest, warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hey guys, you look like party people. Shots are on me.

dialogues.speaker: BITCHY GIRL
dialogues.text: Uh. No. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (waves the bottle) C'mon. This is the good stuff! The girl's boyfriend stands up. Puts a hand on her.

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: She said fuck off, dumptruck. Diana looks down at the guy's hand. Back at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV through the windshield. Sirens on, red lights flashin The squad car pulls up to THE VILLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two COPS enter and see: A BRAWL. Diana is BEATING THE CRA out of the bitchy girl's BOYFRIEND. The cops drag her off.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm cool! I'm cool! She LUNGES for the guy again. They restrain her.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: You're under arrest for assault and public intoxication.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No I'm not. I'm not. The weary cop takes out a Breathalyzer.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Blow into this. She inhales DEEPLY, puts her mouth on the Breathalyzer... .+-and PUKES a GREEN WAVE of MIDORI into it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: How'd I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop walks her stumbly ass over to the mugshot area. The BOOKING OFFICER checks her Florida State driver's lic Sandy Bigelow Patterson, date of birth May 18th, 1973.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKING OFFICER
dialogues.text: Huh. Look at that. You're gonna be 40 in a couple of weeks. Diana looks over at him, trying to comprehend his words.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKING OFFICER
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Sandy Patterson.  THE CAMERA FLASHES, and we're...

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: A man blinks from a CAMERA FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Sandy Patterson. TRISH, 36, his pregnant wife. She KISSES him. Sandy sits around a birthday cake with Trish and his daug FRANNY, 8 and JESSIE, 7, who take pictures with mommy's p

dialogues.speaker: FRANNY
dialogues.text: Make a wish, daddy! Sandy looks at his beautiful wife. His adorable little gi Then he takes in their cramped apartment. Rattling window unit. Cramped space. Bad IKEA furniture. Street noise. He has his wish. He blows out the candles. The girls CLAP.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I made you this, daddy. She hands Sandy a TIE made of construction paper and yarn It says YUO ARE THE BEST DADY.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh, this looks expensive. Did you steal this tie? Thief! Thief! He starts tickling her. She howls "no" through her giggle For a moment, Sandy forgets the tiny apartment and the rattling AC and just enjoys the moment. Looks at Trish.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Thanks. This was a really nice-- He's cut off by A NOISE from the other side of the apartm wall. THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP. Picture frames rattle. And now the unmistakable moaning of a woman being screwed

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (raised voice) Hey Derek? Kristi? Thin walls. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! Franny's eyes go wide. Naughty "oooocco0ch" smile on her

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay. Bedtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franny and Jessie sleep quietly. Bunkbeds. Tiny room. Tri gently closes the door. Crosses back to the table, where the cake has been pushed aside to make room for Sandy's laptop. And a stack of bil

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: After rent, utilities, gas, phones, we're actually up on the month. She's impressed. He turns his laptop to show her. $14.23.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Half of that's mine. (he's not laughing) It's okay. We're making it. Right?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Until she's born. And the girls need braces. Or college. Or weddings.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What about a raise? They haven't given you one in like--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's the financial industry. I can't exactly argue things are going well.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I'm sure the partners are doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Well I'm not a partner. Trish shuts up. That came out wrong. Sandy looks at his c The icing spells out 40th Birthd.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd be further along. A house. A yard. A better life for you guys.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: This is a better life.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Really? Two grand in savings? This place? Three kids to a room?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Babe, you're doing the best you can.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Don't say that. That can't be true. And then... THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP through the wal

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (instant rage) Hey KRISTI! You ever get a PERIOD? The thumping stops. Sandy closes his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm going to bed. He walks off, resigned. The weight of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun rises over the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast time chaos. Sandy barrels through, pulls his ja on, grabs his laptop case, steps over the dog--

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Lunch! He swings back over, grabs a brown bag from Trish, gives a quick kiss. Heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skyscraper downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The placard next to the door says: Sandy Patterson - Acco Processing. The office is basically a glorified cubicle. Sandy works industriously. STAMPS and NOTARIZES documents Legal disclaimers are SCANNED and EMAILED. Fills in IRS f Bank forms. SEC forms. FINRA forms. Trade authorization f Sandy Patterson is a master of paperwork and detail. And at NOON sharp: he stops. The inbox is EMPTY. He takes out his lunch. There's a note in the bag from Tr "Something good will happen today."

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Patterson! BRYAN CASEY, 31, sharp suit, standing in Sandy's doorway. Younger than Sandy, but far better dressed.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Did I ask you to paper the Westfield sweep account under the holding corp?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Shit. It was supposed to go under--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: --the subsidiary, so you can roll over the qualified plan. Sandy hands Bryan an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I did it both ways. Had a feeling. Bryan takes the forms. Relieved. Points happily as he exi

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You're the best, Patterson. The best. Sandy enjoys the moment. A little pride in himself, for o The PHONE RINGS. He answers, chipper.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: This is Sandy Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Cornish needs you in his office for a notarize.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh! Uh, sure, right away! He hangs up. Looks at Trish's note. Something good. It's up to him to make it happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy enters the large, plush corner office. JIM CORNISH, 50, is a short, imperious man. The big wheel. He barely acknowledges Sandy's existence. Just waves at t forms on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: New account forms. Stamp 'em. Sandy takes out a notary book and stamp. Works up the cou

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Uh, Jim? Cornish looks at Sandy. Why is this peon talking?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I know your time is limited, so I thought I'd squeeze this in. I've been here five years, and I haven't gotten a raise. Now I know times are--

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes?

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: There's the man!!! Cornish gets up, walks right past Sandy to greet the clie who just walked into the office. Sandy turns to see Cornish man-hugging: LARRY BIRD. The Celtic great. The most famous man in Bost

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: God, you look terrific. Linda! Two coffees! C'mon, sit down.  Sandy can't believe this. He's awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Larry Bird. I'm--

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Just get the stamp out. Larry signs the three forms, watching as Sandy fumbles to open his ink pad.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY BIRD
dialogues.text: Who's this? The investment guy in charge of signatures?

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Ha. No, he's not an investment guy. He just handles the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm like an assistant investment guy.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Mmmmmmmm, not quite as good that. He's more like someone who works for investment guys, but isn't an investment guy and doesn't have the training or license to ever be an investment guy.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (clinging to dignity) I provide back office support for--

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Actually, he's a bit like those guys who gave you towels, mopped up your sweat? Hung around Celtics, but weren't Celtics?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY BIRD
dialogues.text: (laughs at Sandy) Oh, you're the sweat guy! Hey, every team needs a sweat guy. Cornish laughs with Larry. Sandy forces himself to join i But he's dying inside. Cornish points to the forms.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Go ahead and stamp.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Of course. I'll just need a valid form of ID... driver's license?  10.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY BIRD
dialogues.text: Oh. I left my wallet in the car. (to Cornish) I'll email you the number.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh. Um-- I do need to see it.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY BIRD
dialogues.text: I just told you, I don't have it.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Maybe you could run down and get it?

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY BIRD
dialogues.text: Are you saying I'm not Larry Bird?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No, of course not! But I took a public oath. I can't notarize a document without confirming ID.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: His FACE is his ID, you jackass!

dialogues.speaker: LARRY BIRD
dialogues.text: I'm Larry Bird!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I know! But the rules-- ! Larry Bird stands up. Furious.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY BIRD
dialogues.text: I am six foot nine! This is BOSTON!

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Stamp it, Patterson! Larry Bird grabs for the stamp. Sandy clutches it to his chest, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay!!! Sandy stamps each of the three contracts. WHACK! WHACK! W

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Now get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy slumps back into his office, sits down. Hot with sh Something good will happen today. He CRUMPLES the note up and throws it out. His PHONE RINGS, startling him. He answers. No longer chi

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: This is Sandy Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yes, Sandy? I'm Jeanette with Lady's Choice salon confirming your appointment for this Wednesday at three?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you have the wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Sandy Bigelow Patterson? Odd. His middle name. That gets his attention.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yes, but-- (checks the caller ID) Where are you calling from?

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Homestead, Florida.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm in Boston. How did you get this number?

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: You didn't leave one when you made the appointment, so we Googled you.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry, but you have the wrong person.  12.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You're Lady's Choice in Florida. I'm a man in Massachusetts.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: So you're not Sandy Patterson?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No! I'm no one! GOODBYE! Sandy slams the phone down. A knock on his door. It's Bryan Casey, looking deadly ser

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: We need to talk. Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan enters the stairwell. Stonefaced. Sandy follows.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Bryan, you gotta understand, this Larry Bird thing wasn't my-- Sandy stops. Bryan's there, but so are THREE OTHER GUYS. in expensive suits. All around 30. All looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: We're leaving Prominence.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (stunned) You guys book half the business here.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: We know. And if it were up to Cornish, we'd be sucking his ass for the rest of our lives. That's why we're starting our own firm, and we're taking all of our clients with us.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Jesus-- that's a four billion dollar portfolio...

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Five. Come with us.  13. Sandy is floored. Him?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You're the best at what you do. You'll be a junior partner. Run the back office, plus a piece of the business. What are you making now?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Fifty.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You're gonna make fifty next month.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh my god. When is this happening?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan and his partners stride out to the middle of the fl amidst the cubicles and offices. Sandy follows, hanging back, as Bryan picks up a STAPLER BANGS ON THE WALL, getting everyone's attention. He steps up and stands on a desk.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: The four of us are leaving to start a new company. He raises his Blackberry and presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: You now have our new contact info. Everyone stops. You can hear a pin drop. This is nuclear.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: We will need secretaries. Clerks. IT. You can submit applications on--

dialogues.speaker: NOBODY MOVE.
dialogues.text: Cornish stands across the way. Addresses the troops.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Anyone who stays right where they are gets a 5% raise, here and now. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyone who moves-- will regret it. This firm has offices in twenty cities across five continents. You don't want us for an enemy. Sandy takes that in. The raise. The threat. SECURITY grabs hold of the four rebels.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Last chance. Who's with us? The room is dead silent. No one moves. Cornish gloats.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I am. Cornish looks around, searching for the traitor.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Who said that?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (petrified) I did. Cornish stares in disbelief and fury at Sandy. As securit marches him out with Bryan and the others--

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: You better pray this works out, Patterson, because I'm killing you everywhere else! No one will hire you! Not here, not anywhere! You hear me? You're a dead man! In this town, in this business! Everywhere you go! WHO DO YOU THINK YOU ARE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana rides up the escalator, drinking an Orange Julius, talking on a crappy cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Of course I appreciate it. Yes. Ugh, fine. "Thank you for bailing me out, Moshe." I don't know. Figure two weeks. I'll be done in an hour, and then it's all yours. Okay? As she steps off the elevator, the phone goes BOOP. Call dropped. She casually TOSSES the phone into a TRASH BIN.  15.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE JEWELRY STORE
dialogues.text: She points a ring out to the saleswoman. Credit card in h

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: That one looks great. Lost my wedding ring. Can you believe it? Fifteen years. He's a big stockbroker. But it's not about stuff, you know? It's about partnership.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE ANNE'S PRETZELS
dialogues.text: Diana stuffs an entire cinnamon sugar pretzel in her mout Talks to the cashier through a wad of dough.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Mmm. Low blood sugar. It's working. This is very fresh.

dialogues.speaker: COSMETICS COUNTER
dialogues.text: The salesgirl SWIPES the card. Diana shows off her new ri

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yeah, we just got married. He's a surgeon. He fixes smiles. Diana hears some whispered GIGGLING. Turns to catch two counter girls quietly mocking her appearance. She pretends to not notice.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE ANNE'S PRETZELS
dialogues.text: Diana has another pretzel in her mouth. Talks through an even larger quantity of dough to the same cashier.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Another crash. It's picking up. Is that a free sample? Is that onion? (chokes, then clears) Mmm. There's a nice tang to that.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTING GOODS STORE
dialogues.text: Diana looks at a monitor showing footage for something ca FAMILY FUN PACKAGE. A happy family is whitewater rafting.  16.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTING GOODS SALESMAN
dialogues.text: So how old are your kids?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: 15, 12, 10, 8 and 6. Jaden, Cathy, Sam, JP and Anna. She eyes the large yellow inflatable on display.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Huh. I could buy raft...

dialogues.speaker: BROOKSTONE
dialogues.text: Diana VIBRATES in a massage chair. Asleep. Drooling. An employee nudges her. She wakes spastically.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKSTONE EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Ma'am? Your card and your receipt? Oh. She gets her bearings. Checks the receipt. One massag chair plus home delivery. $1,899.99. Diana does some math her head, then hands the card back to the salesman.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Keep it. It's done. The salesman takes the card back, confused. Diana turns o on the massage chair so that's she face down. Still vibra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Yaris. Sandy drives, cell phone to his ear. It's ringin BOOP. He checks his phone. TRISH (HOME) - CALL FAILED. The LOW GAS alert pings on the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy's redialing Trish as he swipes his card at the pump Boop. Dropped call. Again. The pump says DECLINED - SEE MANAGER. Huh?  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant, ARUN, sits in his glassed-in cashier booth talking loudly in HINDI on his BLUETOOTH earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Something's wrong with pump 5. It's not taking my card. Sandy passes it through the tray. Arun takes it, swipes i

dialogues.speaker: ARUN
dialogues.text: Oh, look at this, buddy! Arun holds up the scanner. It says INVLD. - DESTROY CARD.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What? Why would it say that?

dialogues.speaker: ARUN
dialogues.text: Because you don't pay your fucking bills, deadbeat!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I absolutely pay my bills! And you can't talk to customers like that!

dialogues.speaker: ARUN
dialogues.text: Yes I can. Bulletproof glass. Suck my balls. Arun starts talking in Hindi on his bluetooth. Laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Who is that? Who are you talking to? Arun turns a WEBCAM toward Sandy's credit card.

dialogues.speaker: ARUN
dialogues.text: My family in Mumbai. They're watching me cut up your card. I'm slingboxing this shit to them.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Do not cut that card up! He CUTS THE CARD. Then hits SPEAKER on his cell phone. We hear people laughing, singing and clapping.

dialogues.speaker: ARUN
dialogues.text: Ha ha! You like this song? The chorus means "fuck you".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy drives, fuming. Phone to his ear. It's ringing.

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello, this is Loretta with MobiCom. With whom am I speaking?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Sandy Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: And can I have the last four of your social?

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: And how may I assist you this evening?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I can't seem to make any calls.

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Yes, I see we've suspended your service for an overdue balance of $369.73.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No, that's a mistake. I pay this bill regularly.

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. If you'd like to pay by phone right now, we can restore service to all three of your numbers.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Three? What three? I have two numbers. My wife and myself.

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I'm showing a third line, added two months ago. Area code 305-697--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: 305? Where is that?

dialogues.speaker: LORETTA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Homestead, Florida. 18. Homestead. Where that salon was? And then: Whoooo! Flashi sirens behind him.  19.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy's pulled over. The COP approaches his window.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: We have a hands-free phone law, sir. License and registration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop walks back over. Hand on the butt of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Step out of the car, Mr. Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (gets out) Really? Okay. Didn't realize it was that big of a-- OW! The cop SPINS HIM AROUND. SLAMS HIM against the hood of h car. Arm bent behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy sits alone. Handcuffed. Shell-shocked. Two DETECTIVES enter. Close the door behind them. The lea detective is REILLY, 40's. Moustache. Men's Wearhouse.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Mr. Patterson, I'm Detective Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Listen, there's been a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: There's no mistake. The arresting officer ran your license through the NCIC. You were booked for felony assault two weeks ago in Florida.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Florida? Wait-- was it Homestead?  20.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Oh good, so we're dropping the whole "there's been a mistake". You missed your court date this morning. Judge issued a warrant, we ship you down there tomorrow. Enjoy the weather.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Waitwaitwait. Listen. Please! Someone with my name is doing these things. Making salon appointments, opening phone accounts--

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Are you or are you not Sandy Bigelow Patterson, born May 18th, 1973?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I am, but-- I swear! This is someone else. It's not me.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: (beat, then to his partner) Call Homestead PD. Pull the mugshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly's partner walks back in the room. Hands Reilly a folder. Reilly opens it. Examines what's inside.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Woof. Uncuff him. The partner removes Sandy's cuffs. Reilly takes a documen from the folder, puts it on the table. Turns it toward Sa It's the MUGSHOT of DIANA. Holding a name card and birthd Sandy Bigelow Patterson. 5-18-73.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Who the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: If I had to guess, I'd say it's the woman who stole your identity. Obviously taking advantage of the fact that you have a girly name.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's not girly. It's unisex. So what is this-- like credit card fraud?  21.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: No, it's worse than that. They get a hold of your name, birth date, social security-- then they run up debt, get arrested, commit crimes-- as you. They tunnel into your life like a termite and rot you out from the inside until there's nothing left. (claps his hands) Anyhoo, you'll fill out some forms, we'll put a top level fraud alert out, that's about that.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What? No, you have to stop her! You have to go get this woman!

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: We don't "go get" anyone. We're Boston PD. All we do is open and close the case. If she buys something on Amazon, Seattle PD investigates. Your mobile company's in Connecticut? Hartford PD handles that. And so on and so forth for every single theft.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: How long does that take?

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Six months to a year.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, let me explain our priorities. (gestures with his hand) See, up here, we got our murders and rapes. (sweeps from high to low) Then allll11111 this is the stupid shit people do when they're drunk or in love. (low to the ground) Down here is identity theft.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: So I'm on the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Well, below that's marijuana, cuz you know, fuck it. Everybody gets high. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (rises) That's all. You're free to go. Take that mugshot with you. Might help you with the credit card companies.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Jesus. (writes on a pad) This is my new work contact info. Call me if you hear anything.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: I'll do that. In six months to a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franny and Jessie watch TV. Trish sits at the kitchen tab with Sandy, who has his laptop out. Piles of bills.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Just make a list of each account, and I'll call, one by one, and we'll settle this tonight. Clean slate.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: (quietly panicked) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: There's nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Just gonna pull up the credit card-- WHAT? Look at this! Jewelry? A massage chair? We don't have a pot to piss in, she's buying massage chairs?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Hold on. I'm checking our credit rating. The TRW screen says 205. Sandy reels. Then recovers.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, no problem. We'll start with the First Boston Visa. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're a big bank, we're good customers, they'll get it. TEN MINUTES LATER - Sandy's on the phone, pacing. Trish watches, her panic mounting by the second.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What do you mean you don't believe me? I have a police report! No, not for the jewelry or the massage chair, I just found out about that! Prove? How I do prove I didn't buy something? My identity was stolen! Oh, I'ma liar now? You're calling me a LIAR? You know what? THIS IS WHY EVERYONE HATES BANKS! Get your manager! (beat) Hello? Hello? (tosses the phone) GodDAMMIT! The girls look over at their dad. Frightened.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You quit your job. He registers her absolute panic. Moves into calming mode.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, babe, listen. The new job is a great thing. I swear to you. This is going to get us out of here, into a house, a new life--

dialogues.speaker: TRISH SANDY
dialogues.text: We don't have credit I'll ask Bryan for an cards. We don't have advance tomorrow. cell phones.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH SANDY
dialogues.text: We need a new crib and Trish, Trish, honey. I diapers and-- have it under control. Trish takes a breath. Then puts a hand on his. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Daddy? The TV's broken.  24. Sandy looks up at the TV. The screen says: ERROR 713b: Yo service has been disrupted due to an outstanding balance. Sandy leans back in his chair. This is not under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another high-rise in the business district.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator dings. Sandy steps out into THE NEW OFFICES. Workers install new computers, move in furniture, etc. Sandy sees Bryan in the CONFERENCE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Bryan, can I talk to you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Just a sec. I want you to meet Dave Weiss. He heads up the endowment at Boston University. Sandy shakes hands with DAVE WEISS, 50's.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Sandy's our back office whiz. Handles legal, accounts, every single transaction. He's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE WEISS
dialogues.text: Good to hear. We're putting nearly a billion dollars on your desk.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'll make sure to take great care of you, sir. Umm, Bryan, if I could just grab one quick--

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Patterson! Sandy, Bryan and Weiss turn to see: DETECTIVE REILLY and two uniformed cops emerging from the elevator. Sandy quickly turns to Bryan.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's okay. My identity was stolen. It's a huge mess. Reilly and Sandy shake hands.  25.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: So-- you have some news?

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Indeed I do. You're under investigation for narcotics trafficking. Wait-- what??? Bryan and the client stare in shock.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: We have a warrant to search the premises. Cuff him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy sits alone. The FLAT SCREEN TV is on, the sound mut REILLY enters with Bryan and one of the cops.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Okay, uncuff him.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You mind explaining what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: Chicago PD busted an oxycontin ring last night. Your name and address were on a list of buyers. (off Sandy's reaction) I'm not an idiot, Mr. Patterson. I know there's a halfway decent chance it's your friend in Florida. Which means there's a halfway decent chance it's not. Until I can prove you didn't do this, it's an open investigation.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: For narcotics. Sandy, I'm sorry, but--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY BRYAN
dialogues.text: Bryan-- please don't We almost lost BU over do this. I can't go this. We're asking people back to Cornish, he's to entrust you with their blackballing me information! Account codes, everywhere else-- balances, access to funds--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY BRYAN
dialogues.text: I am unemployable right You can't. Not with this now, Brian! I have no over your head. You CAN'T money, no credit-- WORK HERE! That's it. Sandy puts his head in his hands.  26.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: For what it's worth, I am sorry. Sandy doesn't move. Bryan walks Reilly out. Finally, Sandy lifts his head. Alone. Just him and the si TV. An ad. A woman massages shampoo into her scalp. Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: LADY'S CHOICE
dialogues.text: Bryan and Reilly turn back to him.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What if I knew where she was? I find her, and I turn her over to the police? Would you clear my name?

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: They'd put her up on Florida charges first. It'd be a year before we'd get a crack at her. She'd have to be standing right here to do you any good.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: That's the new standard for police work? The criminal has to STAND RIGHT

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: You have a good day.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Wait! (point of no return) What if I brought her to you?

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mr. Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: If I bring her to you and she gives a full statement-- owns up to everything-- will you clear my name?

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: If all that happens. Yeah. Sure. Reilly EXITS.  27.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Sandy, I'm sorry, but we don't have time. Accounts are rolling in, you can't clear a background check I need someone doing the work now.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Bryan, I have a family. I stood up for you. Please.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: (beat, then) I'll give you five days.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (already running out) Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Five days! That's all I can do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy packs a SUITCASE while he's on the phone. Trish wat

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yes, this is Sandy Patterson, you called the other day? I want to confirm that appointment. It was for my wife, she's gonna be in the area, I didn't realize. Tomorrow at three, right? And your address again? (scribbles it down) Great, got it. She'll be there. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: This is insane. (holds up handcuffs) Where did you even get these?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You know. That place. Oh, and I borrowed your anxiety pills. In case I have to coax her on to the plane.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: No, that's fine. Cause WHY WOULD I

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Shhh shhh shhh. I'm gonna fly out, get her, fly back, and we're done.  28.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Daddy? Are you going on a trip? The girls stand in the door. He kneels down and hugs them

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I am. I'm going to pretty much the worst place in America-- but when I come back, I'm going to be a better daddy. And we're going to live ina big house with a yard and presents and braces and weddings. Okay? (kisses them both) Okay, go on. Be good! They run out. Trish folds her arms, a nervous wreck.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I paid the mobile bill. Our phones are back on, I'll call you every step of the way.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I don't like this. It's dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's one woman. She's five foot nothing. She's a hobbit. (kisses her) I won't let you down. She frowns, then softens. Kisses him back.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You never do. Go get the bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOS-MIA flight comes in for a landing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy drives a rented CHEVY COBALT toward HOMESTEAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A depressed, far distant suburb of Miami. SANDY - sits in his car, windows down. Sweating. Looking LADY'S CHOICE SALON - tacky, tacky, tacky. A large sign o the window says TAN HAIR.  29. Sandy checks his watch. Five past noon. And then-- a new NISSAN pulls into the lot. Sticker in the window. DIANA gets out of the car. Walks into Lady's Choice. Sandy sits back. He's got her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana emerges. Her bad hair is still bad, but blacker and bigger. Nails are bright pink. Jesus. What a look.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. DIANA'S CAR/ SANDY'S CAR
dialogues.text: SANDY follows her, keeping an appropriate distance. DIANA glances at her rearview mirror. Sees the Cobalt following her. Hmmm. She accelerates. SANDY speeds up as well. Doesn't want to lose her. They approach an ELEVATED CAUSEWAY over marshy SWAMP. The only two cars visible for miles. DIANA accelerates more. SANDY keeps up. Until-- SCREEEE! Diana SLAMS ON HER BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Shit! He slams on HIS BRAKES-- SKIDS-- and-- CRUNCH-- he rear-e her at about 15 mph. Not even enough to pop the airbags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy gets out of his car. Sees Diana slowly get out of h She's holding her neck.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Ugh. My neck! Son of a bitch! He can't believe it. She's pulling a scam.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. You stopped so short. He walks around her car, surveying the damage. Subtly pla himself between her and her driver's side door.  30.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: There was a gopher in the road. OW, my spine!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You know what? This is totally my fault. Let's exchange information. My insurance will cover everything.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: All right. Yeah. Cool. Here. (hands him her license) Or maybe we could just do cash. Save you a little on your rates.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You would do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I would. I'm a good person. You know? Like, what would Jesus do?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Jesus doesn't have insurance?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No, he's god. What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (reads her license) Sandy Bigelow Patterson. Bigelow. You don't hear that too often.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's a family name. Mother's side. Goes back to the Mayflower. Jeremiah Bigelow. He was a bear hunter.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Huh. Interesting. Here's my license. She takes it. Looks at it. Sandy Bigelow Patterson. She slowly removes her hand from her neck. Straightens he posture. Looks back at Sandy like she's a different perso Then she PUNCHES him in the THROAT. Sandy drops like a dead man, still conscious, but gagging his own throat. She tries to push past him into her car, he BLOCKS HER ACCESS to the door while he tries to breath She runs and gets into HIS car. Starts it up. Backs up.  31. Watching this, gasping for air, Sandy gets into HER car. Turns the key, but the engine won't turn over. Then: WHAM! He lurches forward into the steering wheel. Looks b She's rammed HIS car into HER car. And now she's PUSHING her car, with him in it. To the edge of the causeway. He pushes the brake to the floor. HONKS the horn.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Hey! HEY!!! But she's not stopping. And he's almost to the edge... it a_good thirty foot drop... Sandy flings the car door open and JUMPS OUT just before- DIANA PUSHES HER OWN CAR OFF THE CAUSEWAY - it goes END o END over END and lands with a SPLASH in the SWAMPY MUCK. Sandy turns back and sees her GIVE HIM THE FINGER as she off in his rental. Stranding him. His phone rings. He answers, still finding his voice.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hey babe, it's me. Just checking in to see how things were going. He peers over the edge at Diana's car. Restrains his own

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Off to a little bit of a slow start. Caught my ankle on the first hurdle there. Nothing to worry about. I'll call you in a few.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Okay. Be careful. I love you. She hangs up. The phone immediately rings back. She answe

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Sandy?  32.

dialogues.speaker: DEBT COLLECTOR, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: No, this is Dan from Superior Debt Collection. Can we speak to Sandy?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He's not here right now. I'm his wife. Is there something I can--

dialogues.speaker: DEBT COLLECTOR, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: He's in Florida, but--

dialogues.speaker: DEBT COLLECTOR, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Florida? Where in Florida?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I don't know exactly...

dialogues.speaker: DEBT COLLECTOR, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: You're saying he left town and you don't know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Yes, but-- Click. Dial tone. Trish looks at the phone. What just hap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy slowly makes his way down the embankment into the m below the road. His shoes SINK into the reeking muck. Ugh DIANA'S CAR - is half submerged in the swamp. Sandy opens the exposed passenger door. Crawls into her car. Opens the glove compartment. Nothing but the manual. Look around. Sees: PINK PAPER wedged in the rear seat. He pull it out. It's a BILL OF SALE for the car. Made out to Sandy Patterson. Goddammit. But below that... ...a Homestead, FL address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prefab homes. Tiny lots. SANDY gets out of a cab. Walks toward DIANA'S HOUSE. The RENTAL CAR is in the driveway. And there's a goddamn MOTORBOAT parked on the lawn.  33. DIANA - emerges from her house with a SUITCASE. Sees him. She drops the suitcase and RUNS back to the house. He CHA and just as she SLAMS THE DOOR, he jams an LEG in.

dialogues.speaker: AGGH
dialogues.text: He pushes in after her, and she backs away over piles of: STUFF. The house is a HOARDER'S PARADISE. Piles and piles electronics, housewares, clothing, sporting goods, camera musical instruments, bulk food items... most of it UNTOUC The MASSAGE CHAIR is in the corner. And the big yellow RA

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Wow. Been shopping, Sandy? He pulls the HANDCUFFS out of his jacket pocket, starts walking toward her. He will not be denied.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Here's the deal. We can do this the easy way, or the-- She PUNCHES HIM IN THE THROAT. Again. He goes down. She tries to jump over him, but he GRABS HER LEG. She goes down, and they FIGHT. A SLOPPY, MESSY fight betw two desperate people, neither of whom can afford to lose. He tries to HANDCUFF HER, but he can't pin her down. She rolls over him, smothering his face in her tits.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (muffled)

dialogues.speaker: GARRR
dialogues.text: She's got her hand JAMMED in his pocket. CLENCHING. He ro in pain, wriggles free... and she BITES HIM on the leg.

dialogues.speaker: AGHHHH
dialogues.text: He starts PUNCHING HER on the back of her head until her jaws RELEASE. They ROLL OVER, and now he's on top of her. Face to face. Sweaty. Her makeup is SMEARED. Breathing in each other's mouths. Close enough to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Huh. Where's this going?  34. He backs away, and she KNEES him in the chest, then bolts for the front door. Sandy grabs the RAFT OAR and FLINGS IT AT HER. It hits her in the back of the head, and she GOES DOWN. He staggers past her. Shuts the front door. Deadbolts it. Diana struggles to her feet, dazed. Holding the back of h head in pain. She flops down on her couch, winded. Sandy sees an overturned SHOE BOX on the floor. Spilling of it are DRIVER'S LICENSES. All with Diana's picture. Al different states. All different names. He grabs a handful

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you? You're sick! Look at all this stuff. You don't even need it!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh, you know me now? He sees FOUR GUITARS. He lifts one up.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. You play? I'd love to hear something. Or are these for your husband? No? Boyfriend? (tosses the guitar) Well there's a shock. That same flash of pain crosses her face. Sandy catches it. And even though she's ruined his life, gets a guilty twinge. He was cruel, and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Julie.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Shit! A POUNDING on the door. INTERCUT WITH: AVI AND ILAN, 20's, Israeli, wearing hones to-god Jordache jeans (still sold at Walmart!) and windbreakers. Total thugs. Hebrew accents.  35.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Diana, open the fucking door! BACK INSIDE - Diana makes a "SHUT UP" face to Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What's the problem, Avi?

dialogues.speaker: AVI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The problem is you fuck Moshe! He bail you out, you trade him shit ID?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's not shit! It's good!

dialogues.speaker: AVI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It doesn't work! He lost twenty grand on this oxycontin deal! Open the door! We just want to talk! Diana grabs a KNAPSACK. Starts throwing stuff in. Makeup, blank MAGSTRIP CARDS, a small keypad device, hairspray...

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Who is that? Diana moves into her BEDROOM. She quickly takes down a PO from her wall, blocking our view of it. She carefully folds it and puts it in her KNAPSACK.

dialogues.speaker: AVI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Diana, don't make me break this door! Diana moves back into the living room, looks for: THE JINGLE OF KEYS - Sandy is holding the car keys.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Looking for someth-- KABOOM! A SHOTGUN BLAST blows through the WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Jesus! KABOOM! Another blast. Diana grabs a STEAK KNIFE and star RUNNING. Sandy runs after her, scared out of his mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avi KICKS the front door in just in time to NOT SEE Diana and Sandy running out the OTHER side of the house.  36. Diana SLASHES two tires on Avi's car with the knife, thro her knapsack into the RENTAL, and she and Sandy get in.

dialogues.speaker: GO GO GO
dialogues.text: Sandy starts the car and PEELS OUT. Avi and Ilan realize their mistake and run back outside, the Cobalt is already driving away, and Avi's car is LEAN on two flat tires.

dialogues.speaker: YOR PIN NOTEPH ZIVA
dialogues.text: He kicks his car. Fury in his eyes. We don't know Hebrew, but we can tell they just fucked with the wrong Israeli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy and Diana drive in silence. Both PISSED. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Just let me off at the next exit.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I don't think so. And I think you meant to say "sorry for getting you

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm not sorry for that. Pull over.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No. We're getting on a plane, Diana, and we're flying to Boston. Diana laughs in his face. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Seriously, pull over or I'll kick your ass in again.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Look. How about we find a bar-- I'll buy you a drink and explain the whole thing. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: A drink? Sure. That's a perfect way to dose me with your wife's Xanax. She lifts the pill bottle up. Rattles it. He checks his p pocket. She picked his fucking pocket during the fight...  37.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Now PULL OVER.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Fine! Is that what you want?! He PULLS THE CAR OVER to the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana gets out. Starts walking. Sandy gets out. Starts di his cell phone. Yelling after her over the traffic noise.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'll just let 911 know a criminal with a known warrant is walking around on the highway. I've got lots of evidence they'd love to see! (she keeps walking) I have your home address, your photo, a handful of your fake licenses in my pocket... (she keeps walking) And once you're in jail, "Avi" will know exactly where to find you. Diana stops.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (mutters to herself) Mother fucker... (turns back to him) You want me dead?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I want you in Boston.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I need you to tell my boss I didn't sell oxycontin or rack up debt or any of this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (sneers ) Oh. For a job. You and your anxious wife gotta maintain your lifestyle, right? I bet Trish is real pretty.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: She's beautiful. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So are my two little girls, anda third one on the way. See, I'm responsible for other people. I'm actually loved. Again, that flash of pain.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What are their names?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What do you care? They're quiet for a bit. Just the sound of passing cars.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Can I still get that drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana drinks a beer, eats pretzels.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well. Looks like you got my tits in a ringer.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I don't like that phrase.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yeah, you really got me ass up over a barrel.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: That's not any better.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Look. You need me in Boston, and I need to get out of Florida. Maybe we can make a deal. I'll talk to your boss, but no cops.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You have to go on record with Boston PD, but I won't press charges.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Let me explain something, Judge Judy. I sold your ID to those Israelis. They use them to traffic drugs. Yours was supposed to last a little longer, which you somehow fucked up.  39.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh, it's my fault they want you dead?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Uh huh. That's problem number one. Problem number two is any DA worth a shit is gonna hang the drug charge on me, cuz it's connected to an ID I stole. That's a ten year stretch in a federal pen. So no cops. Your choice, asshole. He stares for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Fine. Diana looks into Sandy's eyes. Suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You lying to me? Cuz I can smell a set-up.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm not lying. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You swear on your kids?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (beat) I swear on my kids. She keeps looking in his eyes. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well alright. (swigs her beer) Boston. Could be good for me. Fresh start, no rap sheet, wide open hunting ground. You know what? I want to do this. This is my idea now. (pushes the pretzels away ) Salt runs right through me. I'm gonna hit the shitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryan walks through the busy office, cellphone to his ear INTERCUT WITH: Sandy in the bar, one eye on the restroom.  40.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: She says she'll talk to you. But no cops.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: They won't close your case if she doesn't go on record.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's not a problem. I'll text you when we're coming in. Set the cops up in another room, hit intercom on the phone, they'll listen in, and then bust in and arrest her.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: That's your plan? That's porno quality.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It'll work. Just trust me. Bryan looks into an office. "Sandy Patterson, Account Management." There's a STACK of paperwork on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Just get back fast. Sandy hangs up just as Diana gets out of the bathroom. St carrying her beer.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This is a pretty nice joint. I'm gonna grab some ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows Sandy to his car.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: C'mon, just a half-slab. I got blood sugar...

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: We only have a couple of hours before our flight. I'll get you a Snickers.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: And how exactly are we getting on this plane?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I buy two tickets, we get on the plane.  41.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Using what ID?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Using my ID.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: And what does my ID say? Takes him a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Two Sandy Bigelow Pattersons born on the same day. TSA might have a little problem with that. She finishes her beer. Tosses the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go squeege again. This is gonna be a long drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cobalt speeds north on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy drives. Diana has her FEET UP on the dashboard. Cra the stereo. Sings along with The Doors.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes on the road, your hand upon the wheel!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (turns the radio off) Feet down. We drive fast and quiet to Boston. Got it? My car, my rules.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry about all this, okay? No hard feelings.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: There are a ton of hard feelings. There's nothing but hard feelings.  42.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Listen, I need you, and you need me. We're bonded now. We're like family. Like brother and sister. Maybe something a little bit more.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: We aren't anything more. We are less than all the things you just said.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Just saying you're my type. I like ‘em the way you look. Tall.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I am average height.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, stretch. She leans her seat back, puts her feet back up on the das and turns the radio back on.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: The future's uncertain And the end is always near... Sandy looks at the NAVIGATION UNIT. 1,500 miles to Boston Long way to go. His fingers tense on the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: a 45-year old MAN. He's crying. His combover ha unwound and wisps away from his head like a windsock. He's being DRAGGED across a perfectly manicured lawn. A McMansion behind him. A sports car in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: CRYING MAN
dialogues.text: Please! I'll get the money! I swear! You can't do this!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: I can do this. I'm doing it right now. THE SKIPTRACER, 30's, unshaven, mullet, 1984 "Western Exterminator" Van Halen concert tee. A cigarette dangles. DRAGS the crying man by the end of his PANTS LEG.

dialogues.speaker: CRYING MAN
dialogues.text: Who do you work for? I'll pay you double! Triple!  43.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: You don't have any money, fuckmouth. That's why I'm here. The man's head now drags across DRIVEWAY GRAVEL.

dialogues.speaker: CRYING MAN
dialogues.text: OW! Debt collectors can't do this! It's illegal! The Skiptracer yanks the man against a BLACK VAN. Puts hi BLACK BOOT on the man's chest while he opens the back doo

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: You're absolutely right. Debt collectors can't do this. That's why they call me. I do this. I find you, I take you, and I drop your ass off right on their front doorstep. They walk outside, "Ohhh, look what we found!" And then they take all your shit. His phone rings. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Yeh-low. Yeah, I could do Florida.

dialogues.speaker: CRYING MAN
dialogues.text: Someone!!! Help!!! The Skiptracer throws his CIGARETTE into the crying man's face, then LIFTS and TOSSES HIM into the back of the van.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: You got an address? Eh, fuck it then, just give me the name. He takes out a pad. Writes down SANDY BIGELOW PATTERSON.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Consider it done. He slams the van door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy talks on his phone, drives. Diana sits next to him applying MAKEUP in the visor mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, not what I was planning, but we'll be in Boston by Friday. Yeah, I called Bryan. He knows. The girls okay? Okay. I love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So-- how'd you meet?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm not talking about myself or my family. You will never know anything about me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh, I already know a lot about you. I know what you books you read, what you music you listen to, I know what you eat, I know where you live. Credit histories are amazing.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh really. And what did you learn?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Basically? You're bland. You're vanilla. You're khaki pants.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're applesauce. You're a Ziggy calendar.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I get it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (cakes on more makeup) Hey, it's not like my life's been any crazier. I grew up in Kansas.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I don't care. You need me to stop and get you a trowel?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (keeps prattling) Yeah, a little town called Morganville. My mother's still the Mayor's secretary. 70-years old! Nicest woman you'll ever meet. And my dad's a middle school principal, great guy. You actually remind me of him a little.  45.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Really? No, it's curious. With such a supportive mom and caring dad, you turned out to be a criminal asshole that ruins lives.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well, you're painting it with the most negative brush possible.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Paint it with a better brush.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm an explorer of humanity. I get inside people's lives and see the world through their eyes. It's pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: That's such bullshit. You know why you do it. Diana closes her compact. Puts it away. A beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Maybe. I guess it's just who I am.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No. Uh uh. You can't lay it off like that. This is who you choose to be.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You can't choose to be you. You already are who you are.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Think about it. If you choose to be someone, you're choosing to be who you're not. (excited) Hey, look! A roadside sign: WELCOME TO GEORGIA - State of Adventure. Diana instinctively cranes her neck around to look at Flo receding through the rear windshield. She turns back, suddenly with an agenda.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Getting kinda late.  46.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I don't want to stop.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well I do. Tired drivers are worse than drunk drivers. That's a fact.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No it's not.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Well it's a fact for me. I drive drunk all the time-- no problem. Slept drove once-- smashed into an Arby's. He stares at her. What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rental pulls up to a squat, run of the mill low-budge hotel. "Inn and suites" my ass. Sandy and Diana get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go over some rules.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Great. I love rules.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You just broke Rule 1, which is "no lying." Rule 2, we are on a budget. All I have is the cash in my wallet, because someone fucked up my credit cards.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: So we're sharing a room, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Rule 3. We're not friends, we're not partners, and we're definitely not anything else. A BOOP from his pocket. He pulls out his CELL PHONE. It's an INCOMING TEXT: ##OOGSMHPKT45#49<bcktrcrte>## Weird. It's from 000-000-0000. He looks up, sees Diana striding ahead toward the hotel restaurant. He rushes after her.  47.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Rule 4! No splitting up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana walks into the restaurant. Sandy follows quickly.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Welcome to Suzie T's, how y'all doin?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (matches the accent) Honey, we are famished. Just drove all day down from Jimson. The waitress starts guiding them to a table.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh, could we get that booth? Walter can't sit in hard chairs on account of the surgery. Sandy stares at her. Walter? Surgery? Diana leans in and whispers in the waitress' ear. The wai makes an "oh dear" face. Her eyes flick toward Sandy's cr

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Y'all go ahead and take the booth. AT THE BOOTH - Sandy sits down across from Diana.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I like a booth.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Whatever. Just leave me out of your bullshit, okay? (hands her a menu) I'm allotting us each eight dollars per meal. You can have one of the soups or a reasonably priced salad. The waitress walks back over.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Y'all ready?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yes. I'll have the tomato soup.  48.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'll take a full rack of baby backs, mashed potatoes, hush puppies and sweet tea.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (what the fuck?) Uhhhh, you know "honey", that's not such a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Why not, Walter?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It just seems like a lot of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana puts a hand to her chest. Emotionally wounded.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you? This is a beautiful woman. You let her eat!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (wiping her eyes) No, he's right. I put on a little weight from the stress. Walter's a fireman. He got in an accident on the job. Injured his male parts, and now he can't work. She takes Sandy's hand. His eyes are bugging out.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: And I know that's why you snap at me, baby. You just want be out there fighting fires and peeing standing up again, but you can't. You can't. The waitress is touched deep in her little heart.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: We used to make love all the time. Now he barely touches me. Of course, he can't lay with me as a husband, on account of the wound. So he takes his anger out on me, and I feel ugly inside, so I eat. Lord forgive me...! The waitress puts a comforting hand on Diana.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: You wait right here, sweetheart. She walks off. Sandy stares at Diana, drop-jawed. She's s in the role. Dabbing at her dry eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress returns. Puts a massive plate of RIBS down i front of Diana, with all the fixings.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: There you go, sweetheart. On the house. Y'hear? The waitress puts a bowl of watery soup in front of Sandy

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: (cold as ice) Enjoy your soup. The waitress leaves. Diana immediately drops character. D in to her ribs, shoveling the food in like a child.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You're a sociopath. You know that?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Why? Cuz I like ribs?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Because you're stealing. Do you understand rules? You're breaking the rules. Society is based on rules.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You follow the rules-- how's that working out for you? Rules are for losers. I'm free. I'm an Amazon goddess. She briefly CHOKES on some ribmeat, then clears it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Mmm. Very savory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy waits at the front desk for someone to come out. Di stands behind him. Her eyes move casually, but we see her scanning the exits And the parking lot through the window. And the car keys Sandy's hand. The desk clerk emerges from the back. 20's, black.

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: Can I help you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, one room. Two beds please.  50.

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: We only have single beds available.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's fine. Just comp us the minibar. My husband can't eat regular meals because of the intestinal surgery. He can only digest Pringles.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (snaps) That's right. I'm "Walter". This is my wife Myra, and she's a functional idiot. She wears diapers, like a chimp. I'm taking her to Disneyland, because she loves noise and sugar. And even though I can't have sex because my cock and balls were blown off in an warehouse fire--

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: --I wouldn't share a bed with her anyway! I'd rather sleep on the floor! You know why?

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: Cuz you got no dick?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Because she is awful! Diana stares at him. Cold eyes. She turns to the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You got a bar?

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: The Fox Hole. Across the lobby. Diana starts walking toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Hey! HEY! Do not go into the Fox Hole!

dialogues.speaker: DESK CLERK
dialogues.text: Look man, ain't none of my business, and that's fucked up about your dick and all, but you gotta treat your woman better, or somebody else will.  51.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What are we, on the set of your talk show? Just give me the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy enters the lounge. Drunks, lonely hearts, possible hookers. Smoke everywhere. Sandy looks around, sees: DIANA - at a table with AN OLDER MAN. Big guy. Bolo tie, terrible black toupee, huge teeth. They slam back shots.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Wow, honey, you were in here 40 seconds, already made a friend. But it's getting late, and we have a long drive to Boston tomorrow--

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: In your sweet Cobalt! Nice to meet you, Walter. I'm Big Chuck. Man, your little lady is something else!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: Have a seat! Drinks on me.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Diana, we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: If you want to go, go. I'm staying. But Sandy can't leave her. So he sits. The waitress bring over four more shots of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: All right! What's your poison, Walt?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'll have a club soda with a twist. Diana and Big Chuck snarf up their shots at that.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: Bring him a tampon to stir that with! Diana is HOWLING with laughter. The only word she's able squeak out through the laughing is:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Faggot!  52. Big Chuck puts another shot back, slams the glass down on the table, and we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table is LITTERED with glasses. Sandy sits, miserable, while a very DRUNK Diana hangs all over a very drunk Big Chuck. They SING along with the juk

dialogues.speaker: THEM ALL
dialogues.text: Diana SLIPS, falls. Gets up. Start KISSING Big Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, whoa, whoa! That's my wife. Can we go now, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: C'mon, Walt. You don't think I get what's going on? You like to watch.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No. I don't.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Fine. Then leave.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (long, miserable pause) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: Cuz you like to watch.

dialogues.speaker: I DON'T LIKE TO WATCH
dialogues.text: Big Chuck grabs Diana from behind. Goes to town on her bo Really working them with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: You're watchin' me right now. Hey, let's all go up to your room. How about that, beta dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy enters the room, turns on the lights. Dumps his stu Diana and Big Chuck follow him in. Both STUMBLING drunk.  53.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay. We're here. As you can see, I'm getting ready for bed, so say goodnight... Diana and Big Chuck are drunk-tonguing each other. So muc tongue. They're like dogs. Big Chuck eyes Sandy.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: You like that, sissy boy? Yeah, you're gettin' hard now...

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I have never been softer. Please leave. Big Chuck starts taking off his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No! Not in here!

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: He loves it. Look, he's not leaving! (takes his pants off) Still not leaving. Big Chuck slides his underwear off.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh GOD!

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: Still not leaving!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You don't understand! I can't let this woman out of my sight! Okay? FROM BEHIND DIANA - we watch Sandy watching as she pulls top off. Unsnaps her bra. Sandy stares, aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy sits, clothed, on the toilet. Trying not to listen the DRUNK SEX on the other side of the door.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING HIP
dialogues.text: He turns on the shower to drown out the noise. Not enough Turns on the faucet.  54.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: You hearing this, Walter? I know you're in there jerkin' it! Jerk it, cuckold! Jerk it sissy boy!!! Sandy takes a towel. Wraps it around his head. We hear two BODIES rhythmically slapping around through t door. A banging on the wall. Then: AN ASS breaks through the BATHROOM DOOR. A PINK ASS being humped back and forth through the hole. We're not really sure whose it is. Sandy grabs another towel, wraps it around his face, curl up into the fetal position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Chuck flops back on the bed. His TOUPEE is gone.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: Big Chuck needs a minute. I'll be ready for round two in a sec. He closes his eyes. Passes out INSTANTLY. DIANA - putting her shirt back on. Wobbly on her feet. St drunk. Then she sees: SANDY'S ROOM KEY. And the CAR KEYS. And his WALLET. She grabs a CHAIR. Wedges it under the bathroom DOOR KNOB She swipes the room key, the car keys and Sandy's WALLET. Takes her knapsack, and heads to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy is still curled up in his towel cocoon. SOUND - the kaTHUNK of the front door. He sits up. Unwraps himself, turns off the water.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Diana? Diana! He tries to open the door, but it's JAMMED. Through the BUTT CHEEK HOLE he can see the chair and BIG CHUCK passed out on the bed, but he can't get the door op  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana walks to the Cobalt. Gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts the car. Opens Sandy's wallet. Takes out all t cash. Then stops when she sees: A PHOTO of Franny and Jessie. She flips through the photo Stops on one of Jessie... her chubby little 7-year old fa Diana stares at it, almost like she's seeing a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: IN HER MEMORY
dialogues.text: A little girl sits alone in a dark room, illuminated by t flickering glow of a TV. BACK TO NOW - Diana starts to CRY. A rolling, ugly, heavi drunken sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sound of Sandy THROWING HIMSELF against the bathroom door. Diana walks back into the room. Puts her knapsack down, p the wallet and keys and room key back where they were, an CRASH! Sandy finally breaks the door down, TUMBLES over t chair, and lands in a heap on the floor. When he gets back up, there's HAIR on his face. It's Big Chuck's TOUPEE.

dialogues.speaker: UGH
dialogues.text: He finally tears it away. And sees Diana, sitting happily bed, like nothing ever happened. And there's his wallet and keys where he left them. And Big Chuck, face down on the bed, snoring. Ass-naked.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: ‘Night.  56. Diana turns over and immediately falls into a peaceful sl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDY - blinks in the bright morning sunlight. He's sitti on a STOOP by the back loading entrance of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Unnghh... Sandy doesn't acknowledge her. Just stares into the sun.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Was it bad? I don't remember anything. He takes a breath. No response. We hear a RETCHING NOISE. DIANA - ass in the air, on her knees. Knapsack on her bac Puking into some weeds.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Uhh. Foof. (gets up) Don't let me drink that much, okay? He finally looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm not your daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy walks to the car, unlocks it. Diana trails behind.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Can I drive? He stares at her. Wow.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm going to get some coffee, but I'll be watching you. Take one step, and I'll kill you. I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Okay, but just-- at least think about letting me drive. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calls after him) And could you get me some Strawberry Quik? I'm pretty dehydrated here. She gets in the driver's seat. Puts her hands on the whee Pretends to drive, like a child would. In the B.G. - A BLACK VAN enters the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy walks to the counter with a coffee. In the B.G., th the window, we see: THE BLACK VAN - pull right up next to the Cobalt.

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: That'll be all?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Do you sell Strawberry Quik?

dialogues.speaker: COUNTER GIRL
dialogues.text: In the refrigerator. You want some?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Nope. THROUGH THE WINDOW - the SKIPTRACER gets out. Starts gest at Diana. Then YANKS the driver's side door open. Sandy reaches into his pocket, puts a five on the counter THROUGH THE WINDOW - we see THE SKIPTRACER pulling DIANA of the car. Struggling with her. Sandy's pocket buzzes. He takes out his phone. Another weird text with that strange code.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: The hell...? Sandy hears distant yelling. He turns and sees: THROUGH THE WINDOW - Diana is SCREAMING across the parkin lot as the SKIPTRACER shoves her in the BACK OF THE VAN.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Whoa WHOA WHOA WHOA!!!  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy races out to his car just as the van peels off.

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: Sandy freezes. Can't lose her now. He has no choice. He g in his car and TAKES OFF after the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skiptracer drives down the wide open two lane road. Smokes. Windows down. On the phone. Ignores the sounds of DIANA kicking and screaming in the back.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's done. I ran the name through car rental agencies, had a friend get me the Lojak, tracked it back from there. Works every time. (sees something) Hold on a second. I'll call you back. He checks his side-view mirror. The COBALT is coming up o his left side. He lowers his window. SANDY - lowers his window. They YELL back and forth

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
