dialogues.text: Yeah, what?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Did you take my friend?

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Nope!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I saw you take her!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Well then don't ask me, shithead!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Just let her go! I need her!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Find your own bitch!  59. BASH! Diana KICKS the compartment panel and passenger sea forward from the back of the van. Starts CRAWLING through the hole toward the Skiptracer.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Oh! What the fuck! He SWIPES at her, while she CLAWS at him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Sandy!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Bitch, get off my face!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Sandy! Pull around! Sandy slows down, then speeds up on the SHOULDER so that he's on the passenger side of the van.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't know! He thinks I'm YOU!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What?! So what do I do?!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't know! Talk to him! Sandy slows down again, pulls back around to the LEFT sid

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Sir, that is not Sandy Patterson!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: (bashing at her) Yes it fucking is! She's going to the debt collector and paying her debt to the First Bank of Boston!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No no no, listen! I'm Sandy Patterson!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Sandy's a girl name!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No! It's unisex!  60.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Unisex?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: What-- like a hermaphrodite?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Just pull over!

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Fuck you, tranny!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Ram the quarter panel!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What's the quarter panel? Diana and The Skiptracer stop fighting for a second. Shar moment of disbelief and disgust.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's the left rear bumper. Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I don't have collision on this!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (hesitating) I can't! I'm scared!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh for GOD'S SAKE! She LURCHES FORWARD into the passenger's seat area and PU The Skiptracer in the throat. He immediately COLLAPSES head-first on the steering wheel groaning and unconscious. But the van begins moving FASTER. Diana sees:  61. THE SKIPTRACER'S BOOT - wedged between the gas pedal and side of the well. She tries to move his leg, but he's out Diana looks ahead. In the near distance: AN INTERSECTION - with a STATE HIGHWAY - SPEEDING TRAFFIC

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Sandy!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What did you do? (oh no) Did you punch him in the throat???

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's my signature move! Sandy looks ahead, sees the HIGHWAY INTERSECTION.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Steer off the road!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I can't! He's on the wheel! You have to stop this van! QUARTER PANEL! Sandy screws up what's left of his meager courage, hits t brake, slides in behind the van... ...depresses the gas, and... CLUNK. Barely taps the quarter panel.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (distant yelling)

dialogues.speaker: HARDER, YOU FUCKING VAGINA
dialogues.text: BIRD'S EYE POV - they're nearly at the intersection... 18 wheelers at high speed, like a deadly crossfire... Sandy's fingers grip the wheel. Heart beating a mile a mi He goes PEDAL TO THE METAL...

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: WHAM! Right into the quarter panel. A perfect PIT maneuve the van FISHTAILS, starts doing 360's... ...the INTERSECTION DRAWS NEAR... AND... CRUNCH! The side of the van IMPACTS a LIGHT POST, and the van is STOPPED just feet before the intersection.  62. SANDY'S RENTAL - SCREECHES to a stop. He gets out and run over as Diana gets out of the van. The Skiptracer groans, passed out in the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm fine! I'm fine! WHOOO! You did it, man! That was SICK!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (in awe of himself) I can't believe I did that...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You did. That was all you! He turns to look at the Cobalt.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: And look at that! My rental's barely scratched! WAAAAAAAA BOOOM!!!!! A MACK TRUCK blows through frame fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: right to left, literally OBLITERATING the tiny Cobalt. Sandy and Diana DROP DOWN, covering their heads. Bits and pieces of debris rain down. Sandy and Diana rise back up in shock. Look down the road the scattered remains of the rental car.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You should always get collision. He slowly turns and stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, you've come to the right man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Chuck sits behind his desk. Photos of his wife and ki

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: Someone's buying or selling a house around here, they go through me. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, no doubt you've done your research. So you understand this is a traditional community. REVEAL - Avi and Ilan sitting across from Big Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: What this means? "Traditional?"

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: No homosexuals or foreigners or Jews.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: We are two of those things.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: Then I'm sorry fellas. But we kinda like it the way it is around here.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Traditional.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: Traditional.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Like this? Avi holds up his phone. There's a picture of Big Chuck ki Diana in the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: What in the hell..? Ilan walks to the door. LOCKS it. Draws the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: A bartender took this last night, puts disgusting caption on. Then he tweeting it around. Somebody retweeting, everybody retweeting, then our friend get, he send to us-- social media! Make my work easy.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHUCK
dialogues.text: And-- what is your work, exactly? Avi grabs Chuck by the BOLO and WHIPS HIS HEAD down to hi desk, breaking Chuck's nose. Chuck falls backwards and to the floor. Screaming in pain

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: That's my work. It's a good job, yes? Very traditional. Avi crouches down. Put the phone pic in Big Chuck's face.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Now. Who is she with? What is she driving? And where is she going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skiptracer's BLACK VAN rattles down a road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy drives. Diana rifles through The Skiptracer's stuff A GROAN from the back. Diana cranes her neck to look thro the hole: IN THE BACK - the Skiptracer has yet to fully come to. He now DUCT-TAPED to the wall of the van.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do with him? Sandy sees a road sign. FOOD GAS BUS 35 MILES.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: We'll leave him with the van once we get to the bus station, then we're back on schedule. There's a GRINDING CRUNCHING sound from the motor, and th the engine DIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy stares at the SMOKING ENGINE. The van's shot.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Diana! Let's go! DIANA - is in the back of the van duct-taping a FOIL JUIC PACK and straw right under The Skiptracer's chin.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Coming!  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them walk. Sun beats down. Thick forest lines either side of the road. Bugs in the air. Sandy's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's fine, babe. We're still on track. (looks around) I don't know. It looks like where Yoda lives. Hello? Hello? (checks the phone) Shit. He hangs up. Diana's thumb is out, but there are no cars.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Your girls are adorable by the way.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Just assuming. (beat) I guess I should thank you. For saving me back there. You're a good friend.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm not your friend.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You said to that guy, "Did you take my friend?"

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's a figure of speech. See, friends don't steal friends' identities. They walk along in silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: How did you do it, by the way?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Steal your identity? It's not as much fun when you know how the magic works.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's not fun now. And I'd like to be able to protect myself in the future.  66.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Don't you already protect yourself? Don't you have one of those services that monitors your ID? IdentiVault?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have IdentiVault. His face drops. Wait a second. We hear a TELEPHONE RING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: This is Sandy Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: JEANINE
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Patterson, I'm Jeanine with Equifax Credit bureau. We're calling today, because unfortunately it appears someone attempted to steal your identity.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You're kidding me! MALL FOOD COURT - Diana eats orange chicken. A printout o NUMBERS in front of her. She's "Jeanine."

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, no. We did catch it this time. I do suggest taking advantage of our new free service called "IdentiVault" which monitors your credit and accounts 24-7 to protect against theft and fraud.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: If it's free-- absolutely. Of course.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Terrific. I just need some-- Sandy listens as "Jeanine" makes CHOKING NOISES. MALL FOOD COURT - Diana hacks up some orange chicken.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: --mmm. ACCCH. Sorry. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just need some information to confirm that I am speaking with the real Sandy Patterson. May I have your name, date of birth, and social security number please?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Sure. Sandy Bigelow Patterson, 5/18/73, 023-99-4186.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana is at her computer, creating a Massachusetts birth certificate on Photoshop, filling in Sandy's date of birt PRINTER - spits it out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana approaches a DMV clerk. Hands her the birth certifi

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I need to get a driver's license.

dialogues.speaker: DMV LADY
dialogues.text: We can't take copies. This needs to have a raised seal.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (looks around) Oh, okay. I'll order that up. She sees: a bored, pothead-looking clerk at another booth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana approaches the bored, pothead clerk. She hands him birth certificate.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I need to get a driver's license.

dialogues.speaker: BORED DMV GUY
dialogues.text: (doesn't check carefully) Social security number?
ON HIS SCREEN - Sandy's full name and birthday come up. T clerk quickly checks it against the birth certificate.  68. He takes her DMV form and STAMPS IT.

dialogues.speaker: BORED DMV GUY
dialogues.text: Window 5.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I need a new credit card.

dialogues.speaker: CREDIT CARD OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sure, just need your social security number and a photo ID.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS SALESPEOPLE
dialogues.text: Photo ID? Social security number? Driver's license or photo ID? Diana smiles, hands her license over. Like a skeleton key

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy has STOPPED dead in his tracks. Jaw hangs.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: That's-- that's diabolical!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Thanks. Couldn't have done it without you. Every theft starts with a chump. That hits him like a slap in the face. His sorest spot.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Here we go. Got one on the hook. A MINIVAN pulls over, slows to a stop. The window rolls d

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Hey folks! Can we offer you a ride? Inside are: KEVIN, 19. NEIL, 16. EVERETT, 15. All bright smiling in EAGLE SCOUT uniforms. Between them, A GOOFY LABRADOR wags his tail.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Thanks, yeah! We're heading to the Greyhound station.  69.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: That's right down the road! Hop in! Diana clears her throat. Gives Sandy a "no" look.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Ma'am, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Hitler Youth. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Whoa! I'm sorry. She's-- (to Diana) They're Boy Scouts.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Eagle Scouts! Even better!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: That one looks rapey.

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: No way, ma'am. I took an abstinence pledge. See? He holds up his wristband. It says "I'm Worth The Wait."

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: I'm not playing hard to get. I am hard to get! Everett and Neil HIGH FIVE each other.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Holy fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Eagle Scouts sing merrily. Sandy pets the sweet dog. Diana just sits and stares, miserable to her core.

dialogues.speaker: EAGLE SCOUTS
dialogues.text: I've got that scouting spirit, up in my head, up in my head, up in my head-- I've got that scouting spirit, up in my head! Up in my head!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: That's nice guys.  70.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yeah, good thing you have those abstinence bracelets or you'd be drowning in pussy.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Actually, Kevin doesn't wear a bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Guys!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh, you got a girlfriend, Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Well, sort of. Her name's Allegra. She's a Gold.

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: (explains) Girl Scout Golds. Female Eagle Scouts. They are badged up. Diana rolls her eyes. Jesus... Ubhhhhh..

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: We've only Skyped. But we're supposed to meet up at the International Scout Conference in Madrid, and, you know--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Kevin, you dog!

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Been a tough road trip, though. We were supposed to be in Spain by now.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You can't drive to Spain.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I know. I had it all worked out, but then something went wrong. I was pretty upset, but life doesn't always pan out the way you want. Right Sandy?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. They drive for a little in silence. Then...  71.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: How do you know my name? The Eagle Scouts all look at each other. Small grins.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (texting on his phone) Check your phone, Sandy. I think you're getting a text. Sandy takes his phone out. It's that GARBLED CODE.

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: We hacked into your phone's GPS. (points to a scout badge) Computers! Sandy and Diana exchange a look. Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I saved and saved for that trip. And then the bank said someone named Sandy Bigelow Patterson stole my identity and emptied my account. You took my money, and you thwarted my love!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, guys? Listen to me. I didn't-- Sandy moves forward to make his point-- and Kevin lifts a small CLICKER. Click click! On that command, the GOOFY LABRADOR instantly transforms into _a VICIOUS ANIMAL, BARKING and LUNGING at Sandy and held back only by Everett's hand on his collar.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Atta girl, Cookie!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (points to Diana) She did it! I'm a victim like you!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: That's crazy! My name is Shari Blitstein! I just met this man! Sandy stares at her. Unbelievable...

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: One of them's got to be lying.  72.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Isn't it obvious? They're a team. They both got it coming. As Cookie BARKS and SNAPS, Kevin turns down a DIRT PATH o the road and into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: I've got that scouting spirit, up in my head, up in my head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere in a forest. The trees overhead block out most the sun. It's creepy out here. Diana and Sandy stumble forward against a rocky outcroppi Sandy's not wearing any pants. THE EAGLE SCOUTS - stand with Cookie, who they hold back. The minivan is parked in the B.G. where the trail ended.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Guys, c'mon. This isn't who you are.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: It absolutely is. Against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Can I at least have my pants?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: No. Pants are for the civilized.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Then why does she get them? Everett holds up his abstinence bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: Dude. NEIL - walks over with two large DUFFLE BAGS. Takes out a contraption of plastic piping, DRY ICE and NITROUS cartri

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: Scout cannon.  73.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (points to his badges) Physics. Creativity. Invention.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You got Insanity on there, you little fuck?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Diana, SHUT UP! Everett pours a BAG OF SKITTLES into the ammo chamber.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Skittles? You brought us all the way out here to shoot Skittles at us? (unbelievable) Okay. Fine. Let's just get this over-- FOOM! Neil FIRES the GAS CANNON, and Skittles EXPLODE OUT like BUCKSHOT. Every single one of them hits SANDY. Mostly IN THE FACE.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Are those METAL? Diana picks one off his face. Eats it.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Nope. That's a standard Skittle.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Now the lady. Neil AIMS at DIANA, and FOOOM! The cannon's kick throws N aim off target, and the Skittles IMPACT INTO SANDY'S CROT

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (crumples to his knees) Oh wow...

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Neil, I swear to gosh! Just get the snakes. EVERETT - lifts THREE SNAKES out of the duffle bag.  74.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Wait! Now HOLD ON!

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: Relax. They're kingsnakes. They're not poisonous. (points to badge) Reptiles and Amphibians.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Guy, you can't shoot snakes at-- FOOM! We go SLOW-MO as THREE SNAKES hurtle through the ai MOUTHS OPEN, FANGS OUT, all heading toward DIANA-- --and then VEER IN THE AIR like a Mariano Rivera cutter, impact FANGS FIRST into SANDY'S NECK.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Holy shit... The snakes SLITHER AWAY. Sandy holds his neck. He's wheez

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: «+-gnnnnnnughhhh...

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: You sure those were kingsnakes and not coral snakes?

dialogues.speaker: EVERETT
dialogues.text: Oh shoot. We should go.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Dang it, Everett! Check their stuff for money. They grab Sandy's pants and Diana's KNAPSACK.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hey! Give that back! She grabs it, but Cookie has the other end. There's a TUG WAR, and the knapsack RIPS OPEN. Makeup tumbles out... and then the FOLDED UP POSTER. Neil SNATCHES it away from her.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No! That's MINE!  75.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: What the heck? SANDY - through bleary eyes, watches as Kevin unfolds the poster. It's: WONDER WOMAN. Lynda Carter. 1977 poster. Old, but loved.

dialogues.speaker: IN DIANA'S MEMORY
dialogues.text: The little girl watches Wonder Woman on TV. Her shiny out Her beautiful face. She touches her hair. Wants so bad not to feel ugly.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NOW
dialogues.text: Diana grabs at her poster, but Neil grabs back, and it TE IN TWO. Diana lurches forward for the other piece, but TR and falls FACE FIRST into the MUCK of the forest floor.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Let's go! C'mon! The Eagle Scouts run off. Diana lifts herself up. Looks d at Wonder Woman's ripped face. She and Wonder Woman are smeared with mud. And torn apart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana looks through her knapsack. Finds some tape. She desperately tries to tape the poster, but it's muddy slippery, and it won't work. Finally, she gives up. In the B.G., we hear the minivan leave. And Sandy GROANIN

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm dying. Diana tries to shake him awake, but he's fading.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No you're not. You're fine.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Look what you do to people. Look what you do. You're a tornado.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (semi-delirious) You're Wonder Woman?  76.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No. Wonder Woman is beautiful and smart and strong.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You are smart. You are strong. You do what you want. You get what you want. I don't have that. You have it. And look what you do with it. Look what you wasted. He starts to nod off.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No. Don't fall asleep...

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm tired. I got bit by gun snakes.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Open your eyes. Come on! Sandy? Sandy! What about your little girls? Sandy's eyes start CLOSING.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm no good. I'm no good. Diana stares at his fading body. Then reaches under him, and with all her strength-- she l him. Holds him like a new bride. And starts walking. SANDY - opens a bleary eye. HIS POV - her face... backlit by the SUN... she almost lo like Wonder Woman... His eyes close, and we FADE TO BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy's eyes flutter open. He looks like death warmed ove Tries to get up, but his head...

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Easy there, buddy. Take it slow. Sandy looks around. He's on a BENCH at a Greyhound statio Diana sits across from him. Her makeup is back to "normal

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: How did we get here?  77.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I carried you. He looks at her. What? Did he hear that right?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: About a mile back to the road. I may not look it, but I got some calves. Powerful base. Flashed a trucker some titty and got us a ride.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You didn't leave me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Nah. I still want to go to Boston. I don't know. Always wanted to see the Liberty Bell. So. He doesn't correct her. Then checks his body. Same shirt. Weird shoes. Dirty pants. He stares

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What am I wearing?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh, they got a lost-and-found bin here.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (writhes in disgust) Oh, ugh... (then realizes) My wallet! My phone! Oh God. OH GOD! What are we gonna do? Wait... is it morning? Is this tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yup. But it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's OKAY? I have no money, no car, I'm due back in three days, I'm wearing bus station pants, I've got some dead hobo's ass wax on me-- tell me-- HOW IS IT OKAY?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: We have me. at her. And?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don't have to be two people with no money, no car, no food. We can be anyone we want. All it takes is balls and a mark. Someone rich, someone whose name can open some doors. Know anyone like that?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No. No. I'm not doing that.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Come on. You're telling me there's no one out there who deserves wrath of Sandy Patterson? He shakes his head. Then realizes. Yes. Yes there is some who deserves the wrath of Sandy Patterson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see it's across the street from the Greyhound station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one else in the library except the ELDERLY LIBRARIAN and-- SANDY AND DIANA - on the public computers. Sandy checks t employee search on the Prominence Financial website. Dian on the other computer, setting stuff up.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Okay, spoof email headers, anonymous Skype account-- we're good to go.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: This isn't going to work.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Bro, you gotta start believing in yourself. You tracked me down, you drove a van off the road, you survived snake venom. Shit. Stow your ovaries for two fucking minutes, okay?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Good pep talk.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Alright, you ready to cross over to my side?  79.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh god.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Here we go... She makes a quick entry into Skype, and we hear a phone r

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (OVER SKYPE)
dialogues.text: Jim Cornish's office.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hello, I have Carl Schectman in New York corporate for Jim Cornish.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (OVER SKYPE)
dialogues.text: Can I ask--

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Mr. Schectman is the head of security and IT for Prominence Worldwide. You're gonna want to put your boss on the phone, sweetie. It's not good.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY, (OVER SKYPE)
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh, my. Okay. Hold on. INTERCUT WITH: Jim Cornish in his office, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: This is Jim Cornish. Sandy FREEZES. Diana stares at him. He shakes his head. " don't want to." Diana whispers furiously back at him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Do it, ya fuckin' skirt!

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Uh-- Uh, yes. This is Carl Schectman.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Carl Schectman. If you check our corporate website...  80.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: (checks the site) Yeah, I see the name, but you know who this sounds like? This sounds like Sandy Patterson. Sandy freezes.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Is that you, Patterson? I can tell from your weak breath. Sandy looks at Diana in panic. She gestures at him to say something, but he's frozen. The eternal beta dog.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Pathetic. Calling me like this. Who do you think you are? That question again. "Who do you think you are?" And we see a switch flip behind Sandy's eyes. No, not fli Snap. And when he speaks, he speaks with an authority that stun Diana, stuns Cornish-- stuns us.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Who am I? I'll tell you who I am. I'm a man who knows his job and does it. I protect people. I take care of them. You don't know me because I'm unsung. I'm not at your parties, I'm not with your celebrity friends. I'm WORKING. And unlike you, who makes nothing, who creates nothing-- you middle man, you human speedbump-- I have a FUNCTION. You remember Spellman? Talbott? Griffin?

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: (shaken) No...

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You're goddamned right you don't. Terminated for corporate espionage. You know how they found out they were fired? That their stock was seized? That their pension was gone? They heard THIS VOICE TELLING THEM. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My JOB is the security of this company, and if the betrayal the Board suspects of you is true, my JOB will be to PUNISH YOU in every way I can. So if you have the slightest interest in saving your useless, incompetent ass, I suggest you SHUT YOUR SMUG, LIPLESS MOUTH and do EXACTLY AS I SAY! You can hear a pin drop. Diana stares in shock. The libra stares in shock.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Now. Tell me. Do I still sound like this "Sandy Patterson"?

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: (shaken) No. No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm glad to hear that, because we've detected unauthorized data coming from your account and irregular withdrawals on your corporate check card.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: What? I didn't do anything!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Shh shh shh. It's not "you talk" time. It's "me talk" time. I'm sending you an email right now. It's a-- (bullshit) --FDIM9 trace program.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Like you'd understand?

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Right. Sorry. Diana sends an EMAIL. Hits send. An email from ITsecure@prominence.com pops up in Cornish's inbox.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: There's nothing in it.  82.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Nothing you can see. I want you to respond with the following information. Your Prominence user name. Your Prominence password. Cornish types the information dutifully.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: The account number on your Prominence bank card. And your PIN.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Umm... they told us to never give that information out.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I am they. We need it to confirm you're actually you.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. But... is this secure? Sandy looks at Diana's computer. She's on HOTMAIL.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yes. We're using the most advanced email system on the planet. Cornish types his information off his card. Hits send.

dialogues.speaker: CORNISH
dialogues.text: Okay. It's done.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Good. If you experience any strange activity with your computer or your check card, it may be the real culprit. So don't speak a word of this to anyone. Because if you're not the one doing it, maybe the person you're talking to is. (beat) Oh, and one more thing. You ever talk to me or anyone else like that again, you're fucking fired. Sandy HANGS UP. Turns to Diana. Huge grins on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Holy shit!  83. She high-fives him, then pulls him in for a brotherly hug which turns awkward. They fumble out of the hug, and Dian grabs her knapsack.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Okay. Magic time. Diana has her small MAGSTRIP SCANNER out of her knapsack. She types Cornish's ATM info into it. Makes a CARD.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Voila. We got three hundred in cash day. Now we just need one more thing... She logs into Cornish's account through the web. All his files are listed out on the virtual disk.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What are you looking for? Diana opens a TRAVEL ITINERARY for an old trip. There's a corporate account number used for the FOUR SEASONS HOTEL.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: A room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avi and Ilan slow to a stop in their car. UP AHEAD - police are redirecting traffic. A CLEANUP CREW removes bits of the demolished car. Avi sees a big chunk. It's a Chevy Cobalt. Ilan says something to Avi in Hebrew. Avi nods. Then roll his window down to talks to a traffic cop.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Is there a train station or bus station around here?

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFIC COP
dialogues.text: There's a Greyhound station, about 50 miles west down 550. Avi nods, pulls around the traffic, and heads west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the El Camino gases up, Sandy sits on a bench and e a convenience store sandwich. Drinks a Naked Juice.  84. Diana emerges from the store with nothing but a 40 oz bot of malt liquor and a can of Aqua-Net. He watches as she sprays her hair. And sprays and sprays sprays. Like-- the whole can. Finally, she dumps the can and twists open the beer.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It's a quarter to beer. Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I care. Are you angry at your liver? Did it do something to you? He pulls another Naked Juice out of his bag. It's "green machine".

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Here. Drink this. She reacts in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that? Nose blow?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's fruits and vegetables. I don't know how you don't have scurvy.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Margarita mix.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Just try it. She looks at him, surprised that he actually cares. She cracks the juice open. Sniffs at it like a grumpy chi Sandy looks past her, sees a payphone by the bathroom. On of the only perks about being in the middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Actually, we're still in Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You're kidding-- what happened? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm fine, it's a long story, but we'll be in Richmond, Virginia by tonight, and Boston by tomorrow. That still gets us back with a day to spare.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: And she's just gonna confess to the police?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I told her they wouldn't be there.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You lied to her.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I didn't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong. I don't care. I mean, let's face it, after what she's done? One good turn deserves another. He looks over at Diana, who is happily drinking the juice Really enjoying it. She gives him a grinning thumbs up. He gives her a weak smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A run-down house. In the B.G., we can see the Mexican restaurant. Diana checks out a SHITTY USED EL CAMINO park on the lawn. $200 0.B.0. is painted on the windshield. Sandy is at the front door, talking to JULIO, 25.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You sure it's in good condition?

dialogues.speaker: JULIO
dialogues.text: (Latino accent) Yeah. Good condition. It's got satellite radio.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's not gonna die on me?  86.

dialogues.speaker: JULIO
dialogues.text: No, it won't die.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's gonna get me to Boston?

dialogues.speaker: JULIO
dialogues.text: Yeah, it'll get you to Boston.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Would it get me to Vancouver?

dialogues.speaker: JULIO
dialogues.text: Yeah, it'll get you to Vancouver.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: How about Narnia? Would it get me to Narnia?

dialogues.speaker: JULIO
dialogues.text: Yeah, it'll get you to Narnia. In the B.G., Diana slams the hood.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Looks good! Plus satellite! Sandy turns back to Julio, and starts counting out cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EL CAMINO rattles by in the B.G. AVI and ILAN step into the foreground. Approach the bus station attendant booth.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Have you seen this woman? He holds up the picture of DIANA.

dialogues.speaker: STATION ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Your friend was just here looking for her.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: My friend?

dialogues.speaker: STATION ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I told him the lady went across the street with another fella. To the library. Avi and Ilan share a look. Who's this new "friend"?

THE SKIPTRACER - limps past the elderly librarian. Shreds DUCT TAPE on his jacket. His eyes scan the room. Land on the computers. ON ONE COMPUTER - a web page still open to a Craig's List ad. '87 EL CAMINO - 120,000 miles. And an address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skiptracer gets into a rental car of his own. He pulls out of the parking lot and drives right past THE ISRAELIS - who sit in their car, watching. Avi puts his car in gear, and FOLLOWS The Skiptracer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The El Camino heads north on I-95. Goodbye Georgia, hello South Carolina.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, this is Tina calling from Jim Cornish's office. I need to make a reservation. The El Camino crosses the state line into North Carolina.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Our corporate account is PRO56679. And what's the nicest room you have available for tonight? Oh, that sounds perfect, thank you. They cross into Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: If possible, I'd like to arrange his key to be waiting for him. Mr. Cornish doesn't like to go through long check- ins. I'm sure you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy and Diana park the car in a public lot. Start walki CRANE UP TO SEE - The Four Seasons Hotel. Beckoning...  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doormen open the glass doors, to reveal the sumptuous hot lobby. Diana and Sandy walk in like it's the Emerald City Diana flags a bellhop.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Can you let the manager know that Mr. Cornish is here? The bellhop stares at her absurd hair and makeup and Sand bus station pants. Then heads off as instructed.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: This isn't gonna work. What if he canceled the account? They know. Something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: We're fine. It's not a setup. I told you, I can sniff those out. Sandy nods, but she hasn't sniffed out his... The MANAGER, 50, elegant gentleman, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEASONS MANAGER
dialogues.text: Mr. Cornish and... Tina is it?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right. The manager stares at them for an uncomfortably long time Then:

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEASONS MANAGER
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Four Seasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager guides them through a beautiful suite.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEASONS MANAGER
dialogues.text: You have two full bathrooms, butler service, nightly turndown-- Sandy and Diana take the room in. They're a long way away from the Imperial Court.  89.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEASONS MANAGER
dialogues.text: --and if you wish to dine with us this evening--

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yes please!

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEASONS MANAGER
dialogues.text: Le Confit is our four star restaurant. There is a dress code--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh. We're traveling kinda light here.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEASONS MANAGER
dialogues.text: May I recommend our mezzanine shops?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You may!

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEASONS MANAGER
dialogues.text: If there's anything else I can do for you, please don't hesitate. The manager waits for a moment. The "tip" pause.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Oh. Uh, can I charge gratuities to my account?

dialogues.speaker: FOUR SEASONS MANAGER
dialogues.text: Of course. You can charge anything on the premises to your account. Sandy and Diana exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy and Diana come down the grand escalator to the shop area. High-end designer stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I'm so fuckin' hard right now. She's already walking ahead of him to the stores.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Our reservation's in an hour! (shouts after her) No jewelry!  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana gathers her purchased dress from the shopkeeper. He out and sees: THE SALON - a beauty shop. She walks in, looks at the incredible array of makeup. BEHIND HER - two salesladies and a gay hairdresser see he Immediately start rolling their eyes, whispering, gigglin Just like back in the mall in Florida. DIANA - starts to walk out of the store, hurt. Then stops Screws up every ounce of courage she has. Turns back to them. Her voice strangely small.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Maybe you could help me. The bitchiness drops away. This is a woman in need. The hairdresser walks over to her. Gives her a once-over, then offers his hand. As he leads her to his chair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy sits at a table for two. Freshly showered. Crisp ne suit. Looks like a million bucks. But he's nervous. The seat across from him is empty. He s the entrance, looking for her. And then... She ENTERS from across the room. And takes his breath awa She's beautiful. The face-paint makeup and traffic-crash hairdo are gone. their place-- --her own face, her own hair, done to perfection. Same fo her dress. Simple, elegant, and absolutely stunning. She walks tentatively to the table. Unsure of herself, al as if she's naked to the world. He stands for her, unable to take his eyes away from this incredible transformation.  91.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (petrified) What.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You look beautiful. It's the first time she's ever heard the words.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Thank you. (beat) It's all tricks.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's not tricks. It's you. He gestures to her seat.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Please. She sits down. Right here and now, this is the greatest m of her life.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I hope you're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got the Spanx cranked up to eleven. They sit quietly for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're halfway through a huge meal. Lobster claws, crab legs, salad, champagne... Sandy stuffs his face. Lifts an empty wine bottle, signal the waiter for more. The waiter mentions something to the Maitre D', who nods, and walks over to Sandy and Diana.

dialogues.speaker: MAITRE D'
dialogues.text: Mr. Cornish, how is everything this evening?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Tina? How is everything this evening?  92. Diana smiles. Truly content.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Everything is perfect.

dialogues.speaker: MAITRE D'
dialogues.text: Very good to hear. I apologize, but the charges to your account are somewhat-- significant. We do ask that you place a credit card on file. I'm sure you understand. Uh oh. Diana puts her fork down. This could be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You what, Jim? I have our Amex at the office. I'll call Lu Ann in accounting and--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No, Tina. We're not calling Lu Ann. We're not bothering accounting. Sandy slowly rises. Faces the Maitre D'.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: How dare you? I choose to stay here at my pleasure, as do the hundreds of people I employ. I am the Senior Vice-President of Financial Management at the third largest personal investment firm in the world. I travel constantly, supervising hundreds of billions of dollars. This cost of this dinner is a molecule floating in an ocean. And you have the gall to question my company's ability or desire to pay it? Who do you think you are? The Maitre D' averts his eyes in submission.

dialogues.speaker: MAITRE D'
dialogues.text: I'm-- I'm so sorry. Of course. (beaten down) Please, accept my apologies. Allow me to host your wine for this evening.  Sandy nods his approval, like a warlord. The Maitre D' off, tail between his legs. Sandy sits back down. Proud of himself. But Diana is suddenly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Right?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You were a little hard on him.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You know what? The whole world's been hard on me. I don't want to be a chump anymore. You helped me see that.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Did I.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, you messed up my life, but maybe it needed messing up. Maybe I needed a little more of you in me, you know? So thank you, Diana. No-- thank you whatever your real name is.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: That is my real name.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: No it's not. Come on. We're friends now. You can tell me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Fine. It's Marla.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Why are you lying?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I care. I'd like to know one real thing about you. What's the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't know. What is the big deal?  94.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Because you won't tell me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Why won't you tell me your name?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Because I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Because I don't know it! That stops him in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: What about your family? What about Morganville, Kansas? That's all bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No, there's a Morganville, Kansas. It's a nice town. It's real quaint. There's a little police station right there in the middle where people can come and leave babies they don't want. So which name would you like? I had six of them by the time I was through foster care.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't want your pity. I survived. I did what I had to.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Steal from people.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well-- who gives a shit about them? No one gives a fuck about me.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes it is. I'm alone. I've been alone every day of my life. Who's 95. gonna get me a birthday present? Who's gonna take me on a trip? Who's gonna make me feel like I'm even here? (in tears) I buy all this shit, it doesn't do me any fucking good. You think your girls want a big house, you think they want a rich daddy who pushes people around? You're so stupid. All I ever wanted was someone like you. Who was just there. Who cared. You want to be like me? You asshole. I want to be like you. She dries her face with a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This makeup-- I'm never gonna be able to duplicate this-- (beat) I'm sorry. I didn't mean to tell you some lame dumpster baby story. It's all lies anyway. I'ma liar. Sandy reaches out and takes her hand. She pulls her hand away. Goes back to her food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana sleeps peacefully. Sandy watches her from entrance, then quietly closes the door. He crosses to the desk, picks up the phone, and

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Hey, Bryan, it's a little before midnight. I'll be back in Boston late tomorrow night, in the office first thing the following morning. (beat) About the woman... (beat) I'll bring her in at nine AM. Let the police know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun rises over Richmond. the bedroom dials.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy and Diana walk to the El Camino. No one's around.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Did you go to the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I said I did.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Because it's straight shot today and we're not stopping for at least-- As he opens the car, THE SKIPTRACER pops out from where h was curled up hiding in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Well, well, well. He's aiming a Taser X3 dart gun at Sandy. Nods back at th El Camino, proud of himself.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Satellite radio. Got the serial number from the seller. Rest was easy.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Damn. Are you Choctaw?

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: No, I'm Polish.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Cuz Choctaws are born trackers.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well good for fuckin' them. (to Sandy) You're the Sandy Patterson the agency wants. So turn around and walk slowly to that red car.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Please. Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Walk. (to Diana) I don't need you. You can go. Sandy turns and starts walking. Diana watches him. Free t leave if she wants. Then--  97. --she moves to stand between Sandy and The Skiptracer.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You debt collectors are the scum of the earth, you know that? And I'm an identity thief, so-- seriously. Sandy turns around. Can't believe she's doing this.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: This got nothin' to do with you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Yeah it does. He's my friend. You want him, you gotta go through me. The Skiptracer looks at the two of them. Then shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: THE SKIPTRACER
dialogues.text: Fine. He aims the gun, and-- BLAM! The shot echoes out across the parking lot. Diana and Sandy both FLINCH... but nothing happened. They fine. Untouched. Wait-- "blam"? From a taser?

dialogues.speaker: OW
dialogues.text: Blood seeps through his shoulder. He's been shot.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She belongs to us! Sandy and Diana turn to see: AVI AND ILAN walking toward them. Avi raises his gun to S her at close range, but Diana CHARGES and BITES HIS HAND.

dialogues.speaker: AGHHH
dialogues.text: He drops the gun. ILAN grabs Diana. THE SKIPTRACER grabs Sandy. Sandy and Diana instinctively GRAB EACH OTHER. Face to fa Clinging to one another for dear life--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --as_the Israelis pull Diana one way and The Skiptracer p Sandy the other way.  98.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Don't let go of me! Don't let go! Diana sees Avi struggle to his feet. Stumbling for his gu She strains to get her mouth to Sandy's ear.

dialogues.speaker: WHISPERS SOMETHING IN HIS EAR
dialogues.text: His eyes go wide. Scared. Unsure. But she nods at him. Yo can do it.... Avi picks his gun up.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Diana! She gives Sandy one last smile. And then-- THEY LET GO Ilan and The Skiptracer each stumble backwards with their prey-- BLAM! - Avi MISSES HIS SHOT at her-- SANDY - spins around... and... PUNCHES THE SKIPTRACER IN THE THROAT. Perfect shot! The Skiptracer falls to the ground, gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy grabs The Skiptracer's taser, turns, and--

dialogues.speaker: FWIP
dialogues.text: Nails both of the Israelis right in their chests. They both drop to the ground, spasming in pain.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVE
dialogues.text: They both jump in the El Camino and PEEL OUT. Diana CHUCKS SOMETHING out of the window as they drive aw It lands with a clatter between The Skiptracer, Avi and I The satellite radio. Avi struggles to barely sit up.

dialogues.speaker: AVI
dialogues.text: Who was that guy...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the B.G., sirens. The police are on their way.  99. Avi meets eyes with The Skiptracer, them slumps back to t ground. They both know-- it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The El Camino rolls down the highway. One state turns to another. The sun sets, and the sky goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The El Camino rolls into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: DADDY
dialogues.text: The girls run to his arms, and he hugs them like a man wh almost died. Kisses them for all he's worth. Then sees Trish. Grabs her and kisses her. It's a lovely reunion. And then, Trish sees-- DIANA - waiting bashfully at the door. The girls turn and stare at her too.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Trish, Fran, Jessie-- this is Diana. She's going to stay with us, just for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: If that's okay.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: It's kind of mandatory.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I just don't want to be any-- (to Trish) I know I caused you some trouble. Trish is unmoved.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You're welcome for the night. Girls, let's get dinner ready.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit around the table, eating dinner. It's very strai

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: This is a really nice dinner, Mrs. Patterson.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I like how you decorated and everything.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Mmm. More uncomfortable silence. The clicking of forks on plat and little else. And then, through the wall: THUMP THUMP THUMP THUMP Derek and Kristi are screwing again. Sandy sighs. Puts his fork down. A reminder that he's bac in Chump Town.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Is that a frequent problem?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a second. Diana gets up and walks out of the apartment. We hear footsteps down the hallway. Then a knock knock kn on the apartment next to them. Then some quiet talking. Then footsteps back. Diana walks back into Sandy's apartment, sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You don't have that problem anymore. She starts eating. Calm. Cool. Supremely confident. Jessie stares at Diana like she's a superhero. Like Wonder Woman or something.  101. Diana looks back at Jessie.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hey. You got some food on your face.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Here. Diana dabs a spot on her own face with a fork full of mas potatoes. Leaves a big blotch. Jessie and Franny giggle.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: No YOU have food on YOUR face!

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Here? She dabs another spot above her eye.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: The girls are rolling with laughter

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I don't know what's going on. You guys are driving me crazy! Sandy looks over at Trish-- --and she's laughing. In spite of herself. He looks around the table. At his wife, his daughters, th strangest of guests... giggling and joyful and alive. The place doesn't seem so small anymore.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy tucks the girls in.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, goodnight. No talking, okay? Right to bed. He turns to DIANA - on an air mattress on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want to sleep on the couch?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: FRANNY
dialogues.text: No way, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, goodnight. He turns the light off, and we follow him out as he close the door behind him. He's about to walk off when:

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Diana.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You wanna give my doll a haircut?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Go to bed! Silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Where are the scissors?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) In my drawer. He lingers for a moment, listening as the girls whisper together.  Decides to let them play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't sleep. Looks over at the clock. 5:30 AM.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Babe? He turns over to her, surprised she's awake.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: She's going to go away for ten years.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: What else can you do?

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (beat) Your brother's always saying he could use help at the store. That's forty a year. Maybe. (beat) What am I talking about? What's wrong with me? She cuddles up to him. Puts her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with you. Here. Feel. She's going crazy. She puts his hand on her belly.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: I know another kid wasn't part of your plan, but you backed me up. We always back each other up. (beat) Follow your heart, and I'll follow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens quietly. Sandy tiptoes in. The girls sleep peacefully. Jessie clutches a doll with a horrendous new haircut. Diana's covers lower and fall with her breath.  104. Sandy kneels down to her. Nudges her with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: You have to go. (beat) Diana, the police are going to be there in the morning. Just go. No response. He shivers in the cold. Then notices: THE WINDOW is open. The curtains flutter. He pulls Diana's blanket back. It's the DOG under there. He crosses to the window. Looks out onto the FIRE ESCAPE just outside it. There's a NOTE on the sill. Sorry. --D He sits down on his girls' beanbag chair. Suddenly exhaus from the finality of it all. The journey is over. The verdict is rendered. No one ever changes. Not him. Not her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of busy people on their way to work. There, in th jumble of anonymous faces, is Sandy Patterson. Suit. Tie. On his way. But there's nothing good waiting f him where he's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ding. The elevator doors slide open. Sandy takes a breath then makes the long walk down the hall, into:  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The partners are seated around the table. Bryan at the he Sandy stands. Clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I couldn't make it happen. To be honest, it wouldn't have happened anyway. Wasn't meant to be. Not for me. I'm sorry. He turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Patterson? He turns back. Bryan points ACROSS THE HALL. Sandy turns, and we move with him as he walks out of the conference room, walks across the hall, walks into ANOTHE CONFERENCE ROOM, and now we see: COPS - and Detective Reilly - all sitting around the tabl At the head of the table--

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Hey Sandy. Reilly turns an AUDIO RECORDER off. Pockets it. Gets up.

dialogues.speaker: DET. REILLY
dialogues.text: That completes the statement process. You've been read your rights. (to a cop) Take her into custody. (to Sandy) Mr. Patterson? You're no longer a focus of this investigation. We'll be happy to provide your employer with a letter making that clear. Congratulations. He pats Sandy on the shoulder and heads out. A COP - puts handcuffs on Diana. Starts leading her out. Sandy watches her go. Too stunned to speak. Then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cops lead her away...  106.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Wait. Can I have a second? The cop looks to Reilly, who nods. The police back off an give Diana and Sandy some space.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: C'mon, Sandy. I knew from the start this would end in cops. I figured I'd take advantage of the free ride until I felt like skipping out. The old hitch and ditch. (beat) But-- (beat) Hey, I've been a lot of people over the years. It's probably time to start being me. I can't do that on your back. I have to pay for what I've done.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: But why did you sneak out?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Because if I stayed, you wouldn't have let me do this. Right? Sandy nods. She knows him. The true him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: You're a good man, Sandy Patterson. And we are who we are. (beat) I gotta go. As they lead her to the elevator...

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Thank you. She grins back at him through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Huh. This feels pretty good! The elevator doors close. Bryan and the other partners gather around Sandy. Shake h hand. Walk him to his new office. He looks back one last time. But she's gone.  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trish carries a BIRTHDAY CAKE out to the patio table, and sets it down in front of Sandy, who holds their new BABY.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH/JESSIE/FRANNY
dialogues.text: Happy birthday dear daddy... Happy birthday to you... He looks around. His wife, his girls, his baby. His new h modest but his. His yard, his dog, his cake. "Happy 41st" He blows out the candles. Kisses Trish. Then checks his w

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Ooh. We gotta get a move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pattersons sit with DIANA in a family visiting room a the women's correctional facility. A guard stands outside Diana plays "Sorry" with Franny and Jessie. Watches Trish rocking the baby to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I can't get over how beautiful she is. You should've named her Diana, though. Franny knocks one of Diana's pieces back to "Start".

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Oh my God! I'm gonna kill you! I'm gonna shiv you in the yard, you hear me, new meat? The guard raps on the door from the outside.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Okay, real fast. Run it down for me.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Math, A. Accounting, A.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Econ? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (off her look) You're kidding me. We went over it for an hour on the phone... She pulls out a test paper. Hands it to him. A+.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: (proud) Now this I put in your file.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: They're never gonna hire an ex-con.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'm starting a program. I have a few years to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Five with good behavior.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: And how's that going?

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Decent. These dykes try and get up in my sweet junk, but I keep it cool.

dialogues.speaker: TRISH
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm taking the girls.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Bye guys! See you in two months! Franny and Jessie run and give Diana big hugs. Means more her than they'1l ever know. Diana kneels down, and gives Jessie a kiss on the forehea

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Stay beautiful, little girl. As Trish leads the kids out--

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: I'll be out in a minute. They're alone. Sandy hands Diana an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: A little gift. Pulled some strings with Reilly, ran your prints through the Kansas state database. She's confused. Opens the envelope.  109. It's an OLD PIECE OF PAPER. A FORM. Typewritten entries. a tiny, inky fingerprint. It's her birth certificate. Diana can barely breathe.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: My name. (beat) Caroline Budgie. (beat) That's fucking awful.

dialogues.speaker: SANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it's you.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: Thanks, Sandy. She hands the birth certificate back to him.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: But I already know who I am. Diana walks proudly out of the room... down the hall... b to her redemption... Her head held high. Her own woman at last.

dialogues.speaker: AS CREDITS ROLL
dialogues.text: MUSIC: "Theme Song" - WONDER WOMAN Wonder Woman, Wonder Woman All the world's waiting for you and the power you possess In your satin tights, fighting for your rights And the old Red, White and Blue Wonder Woman, Wonder Woman Now the world is ready for you and the wonders you can do. All our hopes are pinned on you And the magic that you do Wonder Woman, Wonder Woman You're a wonder, Wonder Woman
